author: mrmitch
title: Works better than you might think!
review: Every town has snow every now and then so you need outside sporting events.  I got this on sale and after building it, my son and I played with it for days. It has a launcher to send the dude flying up the hill and sometime he will land just right or do a flip its fun to mess with. Really like the mini figure in this set he is "hip", overall a fun set to own.

author: t20a1h5u23
title: Not Great
review:
This set was kind of a disappointment. 

Pros: 
Nice Minifig
Cool Ramp

Cons:
The Launcher hurts you hand when you hit it.
The guy rarley makes it over

It is still a fun set, and the minifig is great to mix with the other Gravity Games Sets.

author: legojoe6678
title: It's still Sports? Right?
review:
Even though the launcher doesn't work that doesn't mean
that this set is horrible. Even without the launcher the ramp 
is cool. Right? The mini-figure is cool too, with his/hers snow-
board, I mean come on. At Least it's LEGO and thank this set
for the pieces. RARE. 

  I will recommend this set to ANY one who would
like to have some RARE pieces. Still, you can do some
sweet tricks without the launcher. :D 

               4/5 Final Decision

author: HarleyMeenen
title: Better in Concept Than in Practice
review:
I got this set to round out my snowboarding sets and because I loved the idea, even if it had mediocre reviews. It's a pretty small, quick, uneventful build. As others have said, the launcher doesn't work that well. I think the design for it could have been a lot better and generated more power. As it is, it's entertaining enough, just a little frustrating to never have the minifigure land. The alternate builds listed in the back look more promising, and I may well convert to those.

Overall, it's not a bad set, it's just not a very good set either.
